Home

Frequently Asked Questions

Find answers to common questions about 2048.city, gameplay, accounts, and more.

  • How do I play 2048?
    Use arrow keys or swipe to move tiles. When two tiles with the same number touch, they merge into one. The goal is to reach the 2048 tile.
  • Is 2048.city free to play?
    Yes! 2048.city is completely free and always will be.
  • Can I play on mobile devices?
    Absolutely. The site is fully responsive and optimized for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  • Do I need an account to play?
    No account is needed to play. However, logging in lets you submit scores, track progress, and join the leaderboard.
  • How do I submit my score?
    After finishing a game, you can submit your score to the leaderboard if you are logged in.
  • How does the leaderboard work?
    Scores are ranked by highest tile and total score. Only logged-in users can submit scores. Daily challenges have their own leaderboard.
  • How do I report a bug or give feedback?
    Use the Feedback page or contact us at hello@2048.city. We welcome suggestions and bug reports!
  • Who created 2048.city?
    The site is built by the 2048.city team, inspired by Gabriele Cirulli’s original 2048.
  • Is my data safe?
    We value your privacy. No personal data is shared or sold. See our Privacy Policy for details.
  • What technology powers 2048.city?
    2048.city uses Next.js, React, TypeScript, Prisma, and Vercel for fast, secure, and modern gameplay.
  • How can I join the community?
    Join our Reddit or follow us on Twitter for tips, events, and updates. See the About page for links.
  • Can I contribute to 2048.city?
    Yes! We welcome open-source contributions. Visit our GitHub or contact us for details.
